alert.note: Alert for Central Arctic Plains; Central Brooks Range; Howard Pass and the Delong Mountains; Romanzof Mountains; Western Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Plains (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 5:55AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Snow Through Thursday With Freezing Rain Possible Today... A weather front moving northeast across the North Slope today will Weaken over the Arctic Coast tonight and then move back south over the North Slope as a cold front on Wed and Thu. This will cause snow to spread northeast across the North Slope today, with snow developing at Utqiagvik and Deadhorse this morning, and spreading to Kaktovik this afternoon. Snow will continue into Thursday in most areas, with 3 to 5 inches of snow accumulation by Thursday. There is a chance of freezing rain today from Point Lay to Umiat to Happy Valley south into the Brooks Range. The freezing rain threat should end by this evening. Kaktovik will see winds to 30 mph with blowing snow and reduced visibility from late tonight through Wednesday night.
